dev_assessment_dob_question_messages.msg: When was Your Child born? Enter their date of birth in the following format: DD/MM/YYYY. For example, if your child was born on May 19, 2015, enter 19/05/2015.
Sorry, this date is invalid. Please write your child's date of birth in this way: DD/MM/YYYY. For example, if your child was born on May 19, 2015, write 19/05/2015.
The date you entered is in the future. Please write your child's date of birth in this way: DD/MM/YYYY. For example, if your child was born on May 19, 2015, write 19/05/2015.
According to the date you provided, Your Child would be under 23 months old. This tool is only for children aged over 23 months. Please enter a valid date.
According to the date you gave, Your Child would be @(round_down(datetime_diff(results.date,now(),"Y"))) years old. This tool is only for children aged 2-9. Please enter a valid date.
Your child was born on @(replace(format_date(results.date, "DD-MM-YYYY"), "-", "/")), is that correct?
Let's try again. Please write your child's date of birth in this way: DD/MM/YYYY. For example, if your child was born on May 19, 2015, write 19/05/2015.

wg_unicef_survey_data.intro:
Thanks for taking the time to complete your childâ€™s development assessment. ðŸŒ±This short activity is to help you better understand how Your Child is growing and learning.

Every child develops in their own way. This tool is not a professional test, and is just here to help you learn about activities that support your childâ€™s positive growth. ðŸ’š

Letâ€™s get started! Just answer the questions as best as you can. There are no right or wrong answers. ðŸ˜Š
wg_unicef_survey_data.end_message_concerning:
Youâ€™re finished! Thank you for taking the time! Remember, while this is not a professional test and is not a diagnosis tool, you may notice a few developmental milestones where extra support could be helpful. If you want to speak with a professional, here are some resources that might help
{development resources 1}
wg_unicef_survey_data.end_message_not_concerning:
Youâ€™re finished! Thank you for taking the time! Remember, this is not a professional test, but a tool to help you better understand how Your Child is growing and learning. It looks like your child is developing well. That's great!

Remember, if you ever need support type {HELP}.

wg_unicef_survey_questions_data.qst: Does your child have difficulty seeing or hearing sounds like peoplesâ€™ voices or music, even with glasses or hearing aids?
wg_unicef_survey_questions_data.options: No Difficulty|Some Difficulty|A Lot of Difficulty|He or She Cannot See and/or Hear
wg_unicef_survey_questions_data.concerning_options: A Lot of Difficulty|He or She Cannot See and/or Hear

wg_unicef_survey_questions_data.qst: Compared with children of the same age, does your child have difficulty walking?
wg_unicef_survey_questions_data.options: No Difficulty|Some Difficulty|A Lot of Difficulty|He or She Cannot Walk
wg_unicef_survey_questions_data.concerning_options: A Lot of Difficulty|He or She Cannot Walk

wg_unicef_survey_questions_data.qst: Does your child have difficulty with self-care such as feeding or dressing him/herself?
wg_unicef_survey_questions_data.options: No Difficulty|Some Difficulty|A Lot of Difficulty|He or She Cannot Take Care of Themselves
wg_unicef_survey_questions_data.concerning_options: A Lot of Difficulty|He or She Cannot Take Care of Themselves

wg_unicef_survey_questions_data.qst: Does your child have difficulty being understood by others?
wg_unicef_survey_questions_data.options: No Difficulty|Some Difficulty|A Lot of Difficulty|He or She Cannot Be Understood by Others
wg_unicef_survey_questions_data.concerning_options: A Lot of Difficulty|He or She Cannot Be Understood by Others

wg_unicef_survey_questions_data.qst: Does your child have difficulty learning or remembering things, focusing on an activity that he or she enjoys doing, or accepting changes in his or her routine?
wg_unicef_survey_questions_data.options: No Difficulty|Some Difficulty|A Lot of Difficulty|He or She Cannot Learn, Remember or Focus
wg_unicef_survey_questions_data.concerning_options: A Lot of Difficulty|He or She Cannot Learn, Remember or Focus

wg_unicef_survey_questions_data.qst: Compared with children of the same age, does your child have difficulty controlling their behaviour, such as fighting, screaming, or breaking rules?
wg_unicef_survey_questions_data.options: No Difficulty|Some Difficulty|A Lot of Difficulty|He or She Cannot Control Their Behaviour
wg_unicef_survey_questions_data.concerning_options: A Lot of Difficulty|He or She Cannot Control Their Behaviour

wg_unicef_survey_questions_data.qst: Does your child have difficulty making friends?
wg_unicef_survey_questions_data.options: No Difficulty|Some Difficulty|A Lot of Difficulty|He or She Cannot Make Friends
wg_unicef_survey_questions_data.concerning_options: A Lot of Difficulty|He or She Cannot Make Friends

wg_unicef_survey_questions_data.qst: How often does your child seem very anxious, nervous, worried, sad, or depressed?
wg_unicef_survey_questions_data.options: Every Day|Once A Week|About Once a Month|A Few Times Each Year|Never

swyc_survey_common_data.intro:
Every child grows and learns differently. This tool can help find areas where your child might need assistance. To make it work, you need to answer all 10 questions.; 

How much is your child doing each of these things?
swyc_survey_common_data.end_message_not_concerning:
Your child is growing and learning well. It is okay if they can't do everything mentioned in the questions. Most children can't do all of those things!;

If you ever need help, just type HELP

swyc_survey_data.end_message_not_concerning:
Your child is growing and learning well. It is okay if they can't do everything mentioned in the questions. Most children can't do all of those things!;

If you ever need help, just type {HELP}.
swyc_survey_data.questions.1: Names at least 5 body parts - like nose, hand, or tummy
swyc_survey_data.questions.2: Climbs up a ladder at a playground
swyc_survey_data.questions.4: Jumps off the ground with two feet
swyc_survey_data.questions.5: Puts 2 or more words together - like "more water" or "go outside"
swyc_survey_data.questions.6: Uses words to ask for help
swyc_survey_data.questions.8: Tries to get you to watch by saying "Look at me"
swyc_survey_data.questions.9: Says his or her first name when asked

swyc_survey_data.intro:
Every child grows and learns differently. This tool can help find areas where your child might need assistance. To make it work, you need to answer all 10 questions.; 

How much is your child doing each of these things?
swyc_survey_data.end_message_not_concerning:
Your child is growing and learning well. It is okay if they can't do everything mentioned in the questions. Most children can't do all of those things!;

If you ever need help, just type {HELP}.
swyc_survey_data.questions.2: Tries to get you to watch by saying "Look at me"
swyc_survey_data.questions.3: Says his or her first name when asked
swyc_survey_data.questions.5: Talks so other people can understand him or her most of the time
swyc_survey_data.questions.6: Washes and dries hands without help (an adult can help turn on the water)
swyc_survey_data.questions.7: Asks questions beginning with "why" or "how" - like "Why no cookie?"
swyc_survey_data.questions.8: Explains the reasons for things, like needing a sweater when it's cold
swyc_survey_data.questions.9: Compares things - using words like "bigger" or "shorter"
swyc_survey_data.questions.10: Answers questions like "What do you do when you are cold?" or "â€¦when you are sleepy?"
